page_analysis.text_content:
Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations

Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots

Key
_____ Curb
- - - Lot line
[hatched pattern] Sidewalk
[outlined box] Required setbacks
[gray box] Buildable area

A
Flag lot
Rear yard
Front yard
Rear yard
Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.
Front setback is 10' instead of 20'
Street side setback is 10' instead of 18'

B
Corner lot
Rear yard
16'
Front yard
Street

C
Substandard Corner lot w/ frontage < 50'
Rear yard
10'
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Front yard
Street

D
Through lot
Rear yard
Front yard
Street

E
Wedge shaped lot
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines. The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.
Front yard
Street

F
Lot with more than 4 sides
Rear yard
Interior side yard
Front yard
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
Street

G
Lot with more than 4 sides
Rear yard
Front yard
Street

23

visual_elements.description: Seven different lot configurations (A through G) showing setback requirements for oddly shaped lots. Each diagram shows the lot outline, required setbacks (outlined boxes), buildable areas (gray shaded), front yards, rear yards, side yards, and street locations. Includes measurements and annotations for specific setback distances.
visual_elements.location: Center of page, arranged in two rows

visual_elements.description: Key showing different line types and area designations: solid line for curb, dashed line for lot line, hatched pattern for sidewalk, outlined boxes for required setbacks, and gray shading for buildable area

technical_specifications.parameter: Street side setback for flag lot
